definition: to inflate/to pump up/fig. to encourage/to boost morale
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
bicycle pump

sentences.english: The neighbor often borrowed my inflator.
sentences.chinese: 邻居经常借我家的打气筒。

sentences.english: Since the football has lost air, we shall need a pump to inflate it.
sentences.chinese: 这个球漏气了，我们需要一个气筒打气。

sentences.english: Somebody else lent me a pump and helped me mend the puncture.
sentences.chinese: 别人借给我一个打气筒，又帮我补好了轮胎。

sentences.english: We use a pump to blow air into our tires.
sentences.chinese: 我们使用打气筒把气打进轮胎。

sentences.english: Often I was urged on by the spectators-at least by some of them.
sentences.chinese: 在比赛时，常常有围观者为我加油打气。

sentences.english: You can pump up the tyres by hand or with this special machine.
sentences.chinese: 这可以用手或用这个特殊的机器给车胎打气。

sentences.english: The manager tried to hearten the players.
sentences.chinese: 经理设法为选手们打气。

sentences.english: Can you lend me your bicycle pump?
sentences.chinese: 能把你的打气筒借给我吗？

sentences.english: My bike is short of gas, do you understand where is the gas station?
sentences.chinese: 我的车快没油了，你清楚最近的打气站在什么地方吗？

sentences.english: Could you please help me to inflate my Swimming ring?
sentences.chinese: 可以帮我给游泳圈打气吗？

sentences.english: He put too much air into the balloon and it burst.
sentences.chinese: 他把气球打气打得太多了，它爆了。

sentences.english: I bought a bike with its pump.
sentences.chinese: 我买了一部连打气筒的自行车。

sentences.english: A tyre expands when you pump air into it.
He(Reagan) sent Secretary of State Shultz to Capitol Hill in an effort to shore up wavering Republicans.
sentences.chinese: 卿舒尔兹到国会山庄去给意志动摇的共和党议员打气。

sentences.english: I put too much air into the bicycle tyre and it burst.
sentences.chinese: 我把自行车轮胎打气打得太足了，所以车胎爆破了。

sentences.english: I'll have these tires blown up.
sentences.chinese: 我要给这些轮胎打打气。

definition: to puff up/to swell up/to inflate/to blow air into sth/(fig.) to encourage/to support
to add oil/to top up with gas/to refuel/to accelerate/to step on the gas/(fig.) to make an extra effort/to cheer sb on
to cheer for/to encourage/to boost the morale of
to applaud/to clap
to be outraged by an injustice
to acclaim/to cheer
heartening (news)/to boost (morale)/CL:個|个[ge4]
to comfort/to console/CL:個|个[ge4]
lit. to inject chicken blood/(coll.) extremely excited or energetic (often used mockingly)
to clap one's hands/to clap each other's hands/high five
to complain of an injustice/to lament sb's misfortune
to bestir oneself/to pull oneself together/to cheer up/to uplift/to stimulate
to cry out against injustice/to protest unfairness
to do one's utmost/with all one's might/at all costs/(to work or fight) as if one's life depends on it
to console/to soothe/relieved
(idiom) a good person, used to praise sb's moral integrity or courage
